fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62741].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, it is possible to see the last login date for users only when the user is coming from internal directory or LDAP. It is not possible to see the last login date when the user is coming from Crowd.

h3. Suggested Solution
We need to get the information of last login from Crowd side and add it to the JIRA UI.

h3. Workaround
It is possible to get this information from Crowd database by running the following query : 
{noformat}SELECT u.user_name, a.attribute_value as lastlogin FROM cwd_user u JOIN cwd_user_attribute a ON u.id = a.user_id WHERE attribute_name = 'lastAuthenticated' ORDER BY lastlogin DESC;{noformat}
The result will be in EPOCH time, you would need to convert it to get the exact date. Every successful login attempt from Crowd user in JIRA, JIRA will update the last login value into Crowd database.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to see the last login date for all users even when the user is coming from Crowd

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62729].
  {panel}

I would like to have an admin tool for customizing the wiki editor.

I love the drop down menu for adding icons / emoticons. Visual cues are powerful in making lists and illustrating status. I want to add to the list, such as when I want to use a green flag, instead of the red or grey flag provided.

We frequently use a table within a description or comment to track small details about an issue that are too small for ramping up another subtask. We update the list as the items are addressed, by changing the icon.

 


||Status||Description||Example||Tested Date||Test Result||Passed Date||
| |*Aspect of Issue*| | | | |
|(off)|Function 1| | | | |
|(off)|Function 2| | | | |
|(on)|Function 3| |9/1/2016|Success|9/10/2016|
|(flag)|Minor bug|Misspelling of "word".| | | |

This makes comments more manageable, because users of JIRA often offer suggestions that modify the scope of an issue slightly. A little green flag next to a users's comment means the suggestion was implemented, and so forth.

If the multi-character shortcut to be transformed into an icon, along with the path to the image file, could be a customizable table in the admin of the system, that would be great.
fields.summary: admin tool for wiki editor: custom emoticons and styles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62724].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There are certain scenarios where JIRA will need to be able to connect to itself. JIRA uses the URL the instance is connected to, so the JIRA instance needs to be able to access itself. If it's not able to do so errors will occur. This information is known to cause issues as mentioned here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fix+gadget+titles+showing+as+__MSG_gadget

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a note on the nginx documentation informing that the JIRA instance needs to be able to access itself and uses the base URL. Therefore network admins would take necessary steps during the proxy setup for this.
fields.summary: Add a note in the nginx documentation about JIRA being able to communicate to itself
Create Ability to Track Due Date Changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62720].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when users filter the issues by certain groups, they can only see the suggested groups that they belong to. This is quite troublesome for admins as admins are not necessary belong to the groups, but admins might need to filter the issues by groups for reporting/reviewing purpose.

+Example:+
'ABC-Company' groups is created, but admin is not the member of 'ABC-Company'.
Admin is trying to filter the issue {{project = ABC AND reporter in (membersOf(ABC-Company))}}, but ABC-Company is not showing on Suggested Groups

h3. Suggested Resolution
# It should show all groups to the users who belong to 'administrators' group
# Admin can configure whether to show all groups to admins n suggested group

h3. Workaround
* Filter the issues in Advanced mode by manually enter the group's name
fields.summary: As Admin, Group Visibility Should Not Be Restricted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62709].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA 6.4, the project-centric view can be disabled on both the user level or on the global level by an administrator. However, in JIRA 7.2.x, there's no option to disable the sidebar. This is a new feature implemented in JIRA 7.2.x - please refer to [JIRA Core 7.2.x release notes - Projects, front and center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/jira-core-7-2-x-release-notes-826896229.html#JIRACore7.2.xreleasenotes-Projects,frontandcenter].

Note that this options is not available for Cloud customers, so it would be nice to have the suggested resolution implemented either way. :)

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to enable or disable the project navigation sidebar
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be given the option to choose to Show or Hide the project sidebar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62708].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when moving issues in Kanban Board, when using ranking the issues with highest issue number are placed at the bottom. 

The Kanban Board view then scrolls down to where the issue was placed. 

This can be confusing for the customers since it moves the focus to the other column, rather than the one they are working on. Example: Moving issue from _In Review_ to _Done_. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Move the issue to the next column and the focus should remain on the column from when the issue was moved from 

h3. Workaround 
Use swimlines in order to have a more organised view
fields.summary: Remove scroll down on a board when an issue is moved to the bottom of a column whit many issues
Operations dialog should also idenitfy issue by summary

h3. Summary

Documentation implies that *Merge Versions* feature will show all un-archived versions, while it shows archived versions as well

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# See the documentation: [Managing versions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-versions-776636296.html], it says: 
#* {quote}
The 'Merge Versions' popup will be displayed. On this page are two select lists — both listing all un-archived versions. 
{quote} 
# Go to a project in jira
# Create Versions
# Archive the version 
# Click Merge Version
# The archived version is shown there as well 
 
h3. Notes
The documentation needs to be edited to:
{quote}
The 'Merge Versions' popup will be displayed. On this page are two select lists — both listing *all* versions. 
{quote}
fields.summary: Documentation implies that Merge Versions feature will show all un-archived versions, while it shows archived versions as well

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62702].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The links on the welcome to JIRA page all point to the same page.
When first installing jira you are directed to the URL of : http://localhost:8080//secure/MigrationSummary.jspa On this page there is a link that reads 'read about these changes in the migration hub' which links to https://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7 

Underneath that are 5 entries of product changes, admin changes, licensing changes, user management changes, upgrade task list.  These all also link to https://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7 instead of the actual page they are referencing.  For example 'Product changes' should link to https://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7/cloud_jira_product-changes to take you directly to the correct link and so on.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.0 and above

h3. Steps to Reproduce
navigate to /secure/MigrationSummary.jspa 

h3. Expected Results
Links should point to referenced pages

h3. Actual Results
Links instead point to the same page.
...
{noformat}
fields.summary: Links on Welcome to JIRA page all point to the same page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62695].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Setting an entity property value to a string longer than 255 characters fails returning error 500 if the property type is set to 'string'.

This is because, as mentioned in below documentation page:
 - [https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/building-jira-add-ons/jira-entity-properties-overview]

{quote}
text: tokenized before indexing and allows for searching for particular words.
 string: indexed as-is and allows for searching for the exact phrase only.
{quote}
It should be documented than the limit is 255 characters when using the type 'string' and a better error message should be returned in case a bigger value is provided.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the entity property type to 'string'
 # Send a text longer than 255 character as the property value. E.g. I have sent below body in a REST request as described in: 
{noformat}
https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/properties-setProperty
{noformat}
{noformat}
{  
   "cachedItems":"[{\"id\":\"57dbe48fc0e1d6f6570ccdca\",\"summary\":\"--- template 1\",\"fixed\":false,\"order\":0,\"toggleUser\":\"Mario Thor\",\"toggleDate\":1474028687137},{\"id\":\"57dbe48fc0e1d6f6570ccdcb\",\"summary\":\"abc\",\"fixed\":true,\"order\":1,\"toggleUser\":\"Mario Thor\",\"toggleDate\":1474028704728}]"
}
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

Either 200 OK, or a meaningful error message
h3. Actual Results

You get Error 500 (internal server error) in the REST response and the below exception is thrown in JIRA logs. 
 The same body is accepted without any problem when the type is set to 'text'.
{noformat}

h3. Notes

This is happening because the value provided is a string longer than 256 characters and "value_string" is set to character varying(255) in the DB. 
 When using type text the single words from the string are added to "value_string".

{noformat}
jira=> \d public.entity_property_value
                                       Table "public.entity_property_value"
      Column       |           Type           |                             Modifiers                              
-------------------+--------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------
 id                | numeric(18,0)            | not null default nextval('entity_property_value_id_seq'::regclass)
 property_index_id | numeric(18,0)            | 
 value_date        | timestamp with time zone | 
 value_string      | character varying(255)   | 
 value_number      | numeric(24,6)            | 
Indexes:
    "pk_entity_property_value" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)  



{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Set the property type to 'text'
fields.summary: Error 500 returned when setting entity property value more than 255 characters if the type is 'string'
Make JIRA Mobile App available for JIRA Server instances

Due to 2 phase plugin system startup, 3rd party plugins may run into problems if

Defaulting all plugins to lateStartup phase would avoid these problems

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62680].
  {panel}

+Issue Summary+

When a user searches for issues not fulfilling a condition from a select field custom field, JIRA shows the wrong results.

+How to Reproduce+

# Create a single select list custom field.
# Add in 3 options (a,b,c)
#* Leave field default as {{none}} 
# Add the field to a screen.
# Create 4 new issues.
# For each issue, select one of the options for this field
#* Issue 1 = None
#* Issue 2 = a
#* Issue 3 = b
#* Issue 4 = c
# Go to the issue navigator page {{Issues > Search Issues}}
# Switch to advanced search and add the query below:
{code}<your customfield> not in (a,b,c){code}

+Expected Result+ 
JIRA would show you issue 1.

+Actual Restult+
JIRA would show no results.

+Workaround+

You would need to use an {{is EMPTY}} condition to find the issues that have no value set for them.
{code}<your customfield> is EMPTY{code}
fields.summary: JQL search showing Incorrect result

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62679].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When an issue is exported using the CSV Exporter (Current Fields) the columns are not shown in the expected order and include the Issue's database ID. 

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.2.X

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Filter of issues. 
# View this Filter in List View. 
# Add some additional relevant columns. 
# Re-order the filter columns
# Save the filter
# Export the Filter Results as CSV (Current Fields)
# Open the CSV File to find that:
## The Current fields are arranged in default order
## Additional Issue ID and Parent ID fields are added to the CSV output.

h3. Expected Results
The CSV export should be an identical representation of the Filter query in CSV format.

h3. Actual Results
Additional column data is added and the fields are not arranged as per the Filter configuration.
fields.summary: Export CSV with Current Fields not a CSV representation of Filter Results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62677].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when JIRA does the index snapshot, it does not verify if the index files are in a working state. When we recover the index files, it could lead to a situation where we need to rebuild the index by performing a full reindex - this will cause downtime and index recovery suppose to avoid the downtime. This defeats the purpose of the index recovery. 

h3. Suggested Solution
To have a health checker before taking a snapshot. If the index files are not healthy, warn the System Admin and do not perform the snapshot. With this, the Admin will be able to recover the index files that is in the working state and perform a background reindex.
fields.summary: Check for index file health before taking a snapshot
Add Fixed Versions to main issue display for links
Request to add couple more stages in the workflow
Edit Release Details from the Release Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62673].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As explained in the following KB: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-fix-gadget-titles-showing-as-__msg_gadget-813697086.html, the way the gadgets are processed in JIRA has changed for improved performance. However, this has lead to issues other network issues that customers may have on their network due to JIRA not being able to communicate to itself. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Give the admins the abilility to configure the processinfg method to either the old, server side processing or the new method where the gadgets are processed on the client side with improved performance.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like to have the ability to configure between the old gadget loading behavior and the new/current behviour

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62672].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently for CSV import if the date format in system is defined as *MM/dd/yyyy* but the file in the CSV file if the date format is defined as *MM/dd/yy* instead of an error message pops out at the validation screen the date get imported successfully but the date is wrong. For example if in the csv file the date is defined as *01/20/16* it get imported in JIRA instance as *01/18/0016*

(i) Have attached a short video demonstrating the behaviour.

h3. Suggested Solution
A feature that pop out unable to parse date format error as well as stop the importing of data for date field until the user enter the correct format in CSV.
fields.summary: Feature thats pop out warning message when user entered wrong date format in CSV import

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Basically, it is a regression from https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28173 whereby users who do not have permission to access Confluence are able to see Confluence's status update on JIRA Activity Stream.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.1
* Confluence 5.10.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a application link between JIRA and Confluence via 2-legged OAuth
# Login user in JIRA which does not have access to Confluence

h3. Expected Results
Activity Steam gadget in JIRA should not show any Confluence related activity or updates.

h3. Actual Results
Activity Steam gadget in JIRA show any Confluence related activity or updates.
fields.summary: Users who do not have permission to access Confluence are able to see Confluence's status update on JIRA Activity Stream.
Warning before adding existing user in organisation

h3. Problem Definition
New Atlassian Connect add-ons create users in the application so they can perform some operations. Some of these operations can trigger notification events.
For example the new JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions (JMWE) add-on user sends a notification when a the add-on reassigns the issue to another user by way of a workflow post-function

h3. Suggested Solution
As a JIRA admin I'd like to disable notifications from these system users from Atlassian Connect add-ons.
 
h3. Workaround 
You could remove the Issue Assigned event from the project notification scheme, but this will stop this kind of notifications from all users, not just system ones.
fields.summary: Ability to disable notifications from system users (including add-ons

h3. Summary

When bulk editing based off of a filter, it will use the issues from the last filter that was run rather than the issues on the page that is being bulk edited.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run a search
# Navigate to a different tab and run another search. 
# Navigate back to the first tab and click on Bulk Edit

h3. Expected Results

The issues listed on the Bulk Edit match the search from the first tab.

h3. Actual Results

The issues listed on the Bulk Edit are shown according to the search performed in the second tab.
 
h3. Notes
Notice that the issues pulled into the bulk edit screen are the issues from the search in the other tab (although it's limited to the number of issues found on the first tab

h3.Workaround
Currently, there's no workaround for that.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62629].
  {panel}

I searched for the existence of this issue and will be surprised if it does not exist. However, the closest I could find were suggesting firing an event on a linked issue.

It would be great to have a new link type that would allow certain fields to be mirrored between the linked issues. Specifically, I would like to see Comments and Status be mirrored. When a comment is added to one it shows up in the other. When one of the issues is closed the other is closed. I realize the status could get messy if the linked issues have different workflows. As a suggested solution If when an issue is closed, if the workflows/statuses don't align then the user could be presented w/ a 'what do you want to do with the linked issue screen'.

Example use case:
# A user sends in a request to JIRA Service Desk for a product issue/enhancment
# The issue is cloned and moved to the development project in JIRA SW
# The developer works the issue to closure in JIRA SW
# Today somehow the Agent has to be manually notified to take action on the JSD issue. It is this manual action I am trying improve.
fields.summary: Add Link "Follow" capability

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62624].
{panel}
Thanks to the implementation of JRA-8580, we can export JIRA issues as CSV file now.

However, if we export issues which include Japanese contents and open the CSV file in Excel, the Japanese characters are garbled because Excel tries to handle the file as Shift-JIS in Japanese locale.

From the view point of Japanese customers, it would be better if we had an option to select the encoding of the file when exporting it.

Cheers,
 Yuki
{panel:title=Update|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
h3. Workaround

Use the *Text Import Wizard* of Excel supporting UTF-8:

!text-import-wizard.png|thumbnail!
{quote}CSV (UTF-8) support: Open and save CSV files that use UTF-8 character encoding.
{quote}
Ref. [Office 365 client update channel releases|https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/office/mt465751.aspx] > _November 10, 2016_ > {{Version 1610 (Build 7466.2038)}} > _Excel: Feature updates_

_[https://support.tradegecko.com/hc/en-us/articles/115001943750-How-to-Encode-CSV-files-using-the-UTF-8-format-]_
{panel}
fields.summary: CSV Export in other encoding than UTF-8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62623].
  {panel}

We have a gravatar compliant server for our network of offices and JIRA, BitBucket etc are all set to use these avatars and it works well.

Users are however able to upload their own avatars directly to JIRA, which overwrites the gravatar image, and also shows up on the activity feed. We have clients and suppliers connecting to our JIRA instance, and as there is no security around the avatar feed, any avatar changes show for all users.

I propose the following solutions to mitigate this issue (and in this order of priority)
# Provide a way to disable local avatars and only pull from gravatar
# Customise the activity feed and hide avatar changes
fields.summary: Remove local avatar support if gravatar is enabled

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62621].
  {panel}

In Jira there are menus and they have highlight foreground and background color. For some reason highlight foreground color is white, which is not easy to see as the highlight background color is light gray. The highlight background color looks nice, but the highlight foreground color should then be black for clarity. I have noticed that in some other applications the highlight foreground color is black, too. Someone also said that the highlight foreground color could not be changed.

In adding link to an issue you can add the link target issue to a text field. The text field is also a search box, which opens a list of issues. In this list the highlight foreground color is black, like it should be.

I see that default highlight background color is blue, which is quite a dark color. But it can be changed. If it is changed to lighter color, you should be able to at least also change the highlight foreground color to black. Why can you only change the highlight background color?

Jira v7.1.10.
fields.summary: Menu Item Highlight Foreground Color should be black by default

Confluence has had the ability to use websudo with a custom authenticator since 3.5, using _password.confirmation.disabled_ flag (see -CONF-20958-).

Why s there no such capability with JIRA?

Doing something similar to _isPasswordConfirmationDisabled()_ in _com.atlassian.jira.security.websudo.InbuiltAuthenticatorCheck_ would bring some commonality between Confluence and JIRA.

Why? I have implemented custom authenticators for JIRA and Confluence - based on [MIDANAuthenticator|https://github.com/MIDAN-SOFTWARE/MIDANAuthenticator] - whilst waiting for a solution to JSD-1244. (Accepting that internal users with a Crowd account get SSO features but external JSD customers don't)

With a custom authenticator I can still have websudo in Confluence; but not with JIRA.
fields.summary: JIRA features that require password confirmation (websudo, captcha) do not work with custom authentication

 !jira_create_room.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62604].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In some cases it might be helpful to have JIRA be able to send out notifications to other linked issues, when the main issue is updated/closed/etc.  Presently this is not possible within JIRA, as all changes to a single issue only follow the given notification scheme which applies to all issues in that project.


For example, if you have a project called "ABC" and there are three issues in the project. In which,

ABC-1 (assignee:John) is linked to ABC-2(assignee: Mary) and
ABC-1 (assignee:John) is also linked to ABC-3 (assignee: Paul).

If ABC-1 issue is updated, John already gets notified as he is the assignee, however it would be nice if there was an option to also notify the assignees of other linked issues such as Mary and Paul.


h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a notification scheme event such as "Linked issue updated" to be created in turn fire an alert


h3. Workaround 
It might be possible to use a 3rd party plugin like scriptrunner in order to create a script that would check all existing linked issues when an update was made, and in turn create an edit/update on those issues in order to trigger a notification.   However this could be tricky since if you have a large environment with lots of issues linked to other issues, in theory you could create a tsunami of email notifications with a single change to one issue (something that could cause severe performance problems, as well as inbox problems).
fields.summary: Ability for a notification event to fire on linked issues when an update is made from the other issue

h3. Problem Definition
Within the Issue Create Screen of JIRA, you currently cannot configure the screen to display a web link field.  While you can select the "Linked Issues" field, this only allows you to link to existing issues in JIRA, and not to remote web sites.

h3. Suggested Solution
I'm not sure if this requires the web links to have a separate field definition from other Issue links within JIRA in order to accomplish, however this would be a nice feature to have for environments that would want to say for example, require a web link exist for an issue to be created.


h3. Workaround 
You could try to create a custom field and place that on the create screen in order to store this URL data.  However this obviously would not be displayed within JIRA as a web link/issue link would display.
fields.summary: Ability to add a web link to an issue create screen in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62575].
  {panel}

The problem with Cloning a ticket is the following:

With existing ticket types, if a project administrator chooses to make existing fields or even new fields required within a given ticket type, a user of this ticket workflow can easily circumvent the required fields by cloning existing tickets previous to when those fields were required.

If the user uses the “Edit” button on the ticket, the user is presented with the required fields and does not allow them to update through the “Edit” option unless the required fields are met (this is OK).
 Otherwise the fields that are readily viewable/editable at the default screen (even previous customized fields that had existing data) allow the user to modify the ticket still, without the need to enter required field data (again, NOT using the “Edit” button or “Edit” screen).

Considering this, it seems as if the only “absolute” option available is to disable the clone feature in JIRA which is a global feature and would affect all other projects.

This is a serious problem where if the administered required fields are necessary for a company/work process or even audit purposes.

Please address this, by…
 1) allow designated existing or new required fields to be properly flagged to the user when a user chooses to clone a previous existing ticket
 OR
 2) allow the clone feature controllable per project and not at the global level, so that a project administrator can turn off cloning specific to their project to prevent users from circumventing required fields
 OR
 3) allow the clone feature controllable per issue ticket type, again, specific to a project – to prevent users from circumventing required fields
fields.summary: Users should not be able to Clone Issues when required fields exist
